text: this is the story of how Psy discovered
his friend had narcissistic behavior and
the surprising lesson he learned about
self-love Psy has just changed high
schools because of his mom's new job and
Sarah was the first to be nice to him he
remembers it like yesterday he was used
to his small town and tiny school back
home but this school was terrifyingly
different with 500 kids per grade
but Sarah was the one who looked him
right in the eye smiled and invited him
to sit with her when nobody else had
she has it all together perfect grades
perfect clothes the latest technology
and friends who idolize her she would
say that when you love yourself you
attract abundance in your life and Zara
was fascinated by that
they immediately become close bonding
over their shared love of anime Harry
Styles and trying to stop
self-sabotaging their happiness and
practice self-love they hang out every
day
but things start to change for the worse
a few weeks into their friendship inside
worries he has misjudged Sarah
it all changed once I visited Sarah at
work
during calculus Sarah bagsai to come to
see her at the local coffee shop she
worked at she pleads that her shift is
boring that the people there are toxic
and that she needed him Psy agrees and
goes to visit her during her break that
evening he waves through the glass as he
approaches the door but Sarah didn't
wave back and looks away
when Psy sees her standing at the till
she looks up at him with annoyance and
asks why he would come to her work
saiso caught off guard by her response
that he doesn't know how to react
he holds back tears and apologizes
before quickly walking away
as he walks off he hears Sarah giggling
with her co-worker
Whispering about how embarrassing and
tragic sigh is and why he has nothing
better to do than stalk her
the next day at school cyan knows he has
to face Sarah in homeroom
Sarah strolls in confidently and
unbothered as always
she starts to talk to size if nothing
had happened as they prep for their
English presentation she confesses that
she hasn't read the book and asked Psy
to lead the book summary and Q a but she
reassures him they'll be fine because
she's read The Cliff Notes Psy agrees as
he couldn't lose marks on this
assignment and needs to keep his grades
up for the class plus he has already
done all the work
the presentation goes off without a
hitch their teacher Mr Jacobs
complements them on their work
especially on the creativity and insight
displayed on their poster board
Sarah proudly thanks Mr Jacobs bragging
that PSY didn't want to do a poster
board but she was happy to do it Mr
Jacobs smiles and then talks about where
they could have improved
Sarah replies before psych could speak
and throw Sai under the bus explaining
that Sai didn't finish his part
the teacher then looks at PSY and tells
him how he expected more from him
Psy runs home avoiding the bus as he
can't spend one more minute with Sarah
as he gets home and opens his phone an
article from Twitter pops up
people who practice self-love
acknowledge their flaws and are thankful
for who they are narcissists display the
opposite Behavior narcissists believe
that no one will bring them contentment
simply because they need constant
recognition and admiration connected
Family Services
say feels comforted after reading that
and feels bad for Sarah her insistent
need to be admired by everyone how she
humiliated him and never apologized as
she took credit for his work
it all started to make sense
she wasn't practicing self-love she was
being selfish and that was the
difference
what would you have done if you were Psy
let us know in the comments and until
next time remember don't ever believe
that you only matter because someone
else doesn't everyone matters including
you
